comment: great professor, she is a very caring lady. she made A&P lab super easy for us. she uploads a guide of what will be on each exam so it tells you what to study. there is no way to get anything under a B in this class if you actually study and memorize the models

She is the best professor I have ever had. She's so sweet, and genuinly cares for her students success. I normally don't give reviews on here, but I had to for her. I wish I could take her for every science class in the future. Love her sm
Tests go from slid
Tests are from slides/objectives. Didn't use the text

100% recommend. i got an 88, but i blame myself. if i didn't cram my studying in last min i would've gotten high As on every exam, they come straight from the very organized ppts and she gives review questions. still got decent grades on them despite procrastinating, not too hard! self paced, hw and quizzes and extra credit due by exam date

You have to work for the grade, but Professor Elhassey makes A&P 1 very manageable. She cares for the students and wants you to attend SI sessions to make sure you grasp the material clearly. Her lectures can be a bit fast, but she allows for audio recordings. She also has review questions at the end of each chapter and unit.
Lectures aren't mandatory, but the in-class assignments are. the tests are kind of lengthy and there's a lot of material, but overall it is not that hard of a class
She is amazing!! A&P is a hard course but she makes this class enjoyable. She is test heavy but they are exactly like her lectures and easy to pass. Highly recommend her.

Take her for A&P 1 lecture if you can! She is so incredible and truly cares about all her students. If you show up to class and listen to lectures she help you in any way she can. 
She gives lots of extra credit and you wont fail if you just put in a little effort! 
She's AMAZING.

Dr. E was a great professor. She explained her lectures thoroughly and in depth. You still have to study a lot outside of lecture. Her tests are simple but a lot of content. Each chapter ended with HW that isn't too hard to do. She just wants us to do well. Very kind and understanding. Everything is due by each exam date so you have a lot of time!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Lecture heavy

comment: Obviously it doesn't matter who you take for lab, easy A if you study, but she was a good lab prof who cared about her students learning. Answers questions well and asks you questions about the material before you leave class. Answers emails.

The class itself is tough, but this professor explains the material well and is willing to help if you need clarification. Extra credit is offered before every test. I took her lecture for both A&P 1 and 2. I highly recommend this professor.

Bio1108 Lab was a nightmare, but she tried to make it easier for us. The lab manuals and pre-labs were awful since there was too much information and not enough substance. She broke it down for us during lab as best she could and always was ready to clarify. Utilize the time you have in lab instead of leaving early she gives you extra tips.

Dr. Elhassey was a great A&P 2 professor. This class has a lot of content, but with the PowerPoints she provided and the reviews, she helped to make it as easy as possible. She gives extra credit and really does care. The homework helps a lot with keeping your grade up, so definitely do all of the homework!
the best anatomy professor!!

This class has a lot of content, but Professor Elhassey provided very detailed PowerPoints that were great when studying. She provides reviews for tests that help so much. She truly does care about her students and wants them to succeed. There were homework assignments, quizzes, tests, extra credit, and a two-part final.

TAKE HER FOR A&P 1 LAB!!! Only 3 exams in person ( timed with stations, mostly identifying structure and function ). ppt's and resources you'll need she gives you on D2L. Shes really detailed in her notes so you'll get atleast a B on the tests. She's great take her for both lab and lecture and you'll do great in A&P 1. No doubt
rating_tags: Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT--Graded by few things

comment: TAKE HER FOR A&P 1! You will get an A guaranteed if you do all the quizzes (Lockdown browser, no camera tho) and extra credit ( lots of opportunities) .Exams are in person but take it on online. Lockdown browser as well but she doesn't check if you turn it in before you leave the room... ;) attendance isn't mandatory too since all ppt are online

Elhassey was a great professor! She gave many opportunities for extra credit. This is a hard class in general, so your gonna have to show up and go over some material yourself!!! If your'e planning on taking A/P 1 please take her as your first choice.

Elhassey is a very well respected professor. Don't let the bad reviews scare you. Any A&P class is hard, period. She teaches well, provides extra credit before exams, does unit reviews for the class before an exam, extends due dates, and provides little homework. Exams are hard just like any A&P class. She is great. I would highly recommend!!
Dr. Elhassey is so kind and if you study you will get an A!!!!

Dr. Elhassey was a well-respected professor. Her tests come straight from her PPTs. She has bonus points before every exam which pumps your grade up a bit. quizzes and unit quizzes at home except the first quiz. Hard class but manageable to get an A if you manage your time. Don't take W/ORGO don't be stupid like me! Peace out xoxo

She is an amazing professor. Very sweet. She is willing to help and has extended the deadline a few times. I am currently taking her for lecture and lab, and she asks questions in class about the material to help you learn the material. She does move fast at times, but that's normal for this course. Even so, she stops and reviews things. Recommend!
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I genuinely liked Dr. Elhassey. Don't let the other reviews scare you! She is very soft spoken, but is willing to help if you have any questions. This class curriculum is just kind of a mess, but they are very open to feedback. I would take her again if I had the choice to.

Dr. Elhassey was a great professor for both A&P one lab/lecture. The powerpoints are very heavy and require time to study after the lecture. She moves very quickly through the slides but reviews over content before some lectures. She also gives extra credit along with some extensions if needed by the class. If you study hard you should get an A.

Professor Elhassey is lenient and provides a lot of opportunities to increase your grade/gives many extensions. She lectures almost straight off the powerpoint which she posts. Powerpoints are heavy that must be studied in detail before the test. An A is possible if you study well and complete all the assignments.

She was very soft spoken but willing to help. I stayed longer and received help on labeling and she reviewed it with me. Best advice she gave was studying 1-2 hours a day over each lab material, a class ahead or after. I wish the advice was shared early on but, you live and learn. Also very understanding to sick/doc appointments. I recommend her.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: This professor does not like to answer questions. She can be easily misunderstood: 1. Her protocol instructions  don't always match the lab. The differences are not clear. 2. Sometimes the answers to questions she provides are not accurate. 3. She takes points off for not properly following instructions.

I really enjoyed Dr. Elhassy's class. She gave you everything you needed to succeed, and everything on her tests was in her lectures. She offers extra credit, and she will answer all your questions. You can tell she really cares about her students.
I have no issues with here, she was great teacher
She was very knowledgeable professor

Be wary attendance is for a grade even if it isn't mentioned at the beginning of the course or in the syllabus. Exams are all multiple choice and true/false but go into a lot more detail than required for an undergrad class.
Reads through powerpoints without elaboration. Very soft spoken and difficult to hear. Provides no additional resources very much is setting you out to fail.
DO NOT TAKE HER. SHE IS THE WROSE. don't answer emails and if you talk to her in person all she going to do is just nod and not really help you. Please go somewhere els!!!
DO NOT TAKE HER IT IS A WASTE. SHE DOSENT REALLY HELP YOU WITH ANYTHING. PLEASE GO AND FIND ANOTHER TEACHER OUTSIDE OF HER. CHANGE HER GRADE METHOD WAY TO MAN TIMES

I loved Professor Elhassey. I had her for lab and lecture. Although the class was difficult, an A is 100% doable. She is accommodating if you show genuine effort & you can tell she cares. Very PowerPoint based. She holds review days where participation is mandatory. The tests vary in difficulty but I worked hard and got an A. Lots of extra credit.

My only problem with her is that she is very soft-spoken while lecturing. There is a lot of memorization, but each anatomy 1 lab section has the same tests and assignments. She provides plenty of study materials on D2L, so I'm not sure why the other review mentioned that. However, she is accommodating, and you can tell she does care.

Reads through powerpoints without elaboration. Very soft spoken and difficult to hear. Provides no additional resources. Thankfully I knew students in other classes who were willing to share the study material etc that their professors had provided or I probably wouldn't have survived.
Not sure how she is in lecture but would not recommend for lab.
